page.title: 15PRIVATE EDUCATION
page.content: Fernden is a preparatory school for about 130 boys with accommodation for 95 boarders. The school was founded in 1907 by Mr Norman Brownrigg who in 1935 was succeeded as headmaster by his son Mr Charles Brownrigg. Current headmaster is Mr F.G. Skipwith. It is likely to close for financial reasons. The school stands just outside Haslemere in its own 75 acre estate some 600 feet above sea level.The main building was originally a large 19-century country house containig living accommodation for the boarders, the headmaster and his family, and the matrons. It includes the large modern dining_room and kitchens, constructed during 1974 and 1975; also the main classrooms, the gymnasium, the stage and the school chapel. In the same area are the science laboratory and a new art block.
